蟞蟞蟞

蟞字的基本解释

蟞
biē
〔珠蟞〕古书上说的一种水生动物。
古同“鳖”。

蟞
bié
〔蟞蜉〕即“蚍蜉”，大蚂蚁。

蟞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bié］
［《集韻》蒲結切，入屑，並。］
见“蟞蜉”。
[②]［biē］
［《集韻》必列切，入薛，幫。］
珠蟞。传说中的一种鱼。

蟞字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蟞； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1097第04
【集韻】蒲結切，音蹩。蟞蜉，蟲名，蟻也。　又匹蔑切，音撇。義同。　又必結切，音彆。【博雅】蛺蝶，蟞蚨。　又【玉篇】珠蟞也。【郭璞·江賦】頳蟞胏躍而吐璣。【註】《山海經》曰：珠蟞之魚，其狀如胏而有目，六足，有珠。【南越志】珠蟞吐珠。　又羌名。【後漢·張奐傳】羌?尾、摩蟞等，脅同種，復鈔三輔。

蟞字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蟞字的起名意思

暂无。

Moor
Basic explanation of words
Moor
biē
[Pearl] An aquatic animal mentioned in ancient books.
The ancient same "turtle".
Moor
bié
〔Mayfly〕 means "Mayfly", big ant.
Moor
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bié］
["Ji Yun" Pu knot cut, into chips, and. ]
See "Mayfly".
[②]［biē］
["Ji Yun" must be cut, enter Xue, help. ]
Pearl moth. A legendary fish.
Moor
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蟞; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1097 Page 04
[Ji Yun] Pu knot cut, sound crappy. Mayfly, insect name, ant too.　Pie Qi Mianqi again, the tone is aberrant. The same meaning.　It must be knotted again, sound bye. [Bo Ya] Vanessa, worms.　[Jade articles] Beads also. 【Guo Pu·Jiang Fu】The lollipops leaped and spit out. [Note] "Shan Hai Jing" says: The beaded fish, its shape is like a nap but has eyes, six legs, and beads. [Nan Yue Zhi] Zhu Mo spit out beads.　And Qiang name. [The Story of Zhang Huan in the Later Han Dynasty] Qiang? Tail, Moya, etc., threatened by the same species, and three assistants for the recovered banknotes.
